Library.description: This library contains the code for the Active Collboration objects
Library.name: Ac0ActiveCollaboration

ParameterInfo.description: The request is a list of CreateOrUpdateCommentRequest structures which holds the data required to create new Ac0Comment object(s) or update existing Ac0Comment object(s).

Operation.description: This operation creates or updates a comment.
Operation.name: createOrUpdateComment
Operation.returnDescription:
The ServiceData contains the created or updated objects. The following partial errors may be returned:
•    455003: The comment could not be created because there is no comment text.
Operation.useCase:
•    A user replies to a comment in a conversation.
•    A user updates an existing comment in the conversation

ParameterInfo.description: A list of CreateOrUpdateCommentRequest2 structures which holds the data required to create new Ac0Comment objects or update existing Ac0Comment objects.

Operation.description: This operation creates or updates a comment.
Operation.name: createOrUpdateComment2
Operation.returnDescription:
The created or updated objects. The following partial errors may be returned:

•    455003: The comment could not be created because the there is no comment text.
•    455018: The related object type “$1” is not supported.
Operation.useCase:
• A user replies to a comment in a conversation.
    • A user updates an existing comment in a conversation
    • A user replies or updates an existing comment in a conversation and associates additional objects with the comment. For example, a user may add a Teamcenter snapshot to the comment.

ParameterInfo.description: The request contains a CreateOrUpdateConversationRequest structure which holds the data required to create a new Ac0Conversation object or update an existing Ac0Conversation object.

Operation.description: This operation creates or updates a conversation.
Operation.name: createOrUpdateConversation
Operation.returnDescription:
The created or updated Ac0Conversation objects. The following partial errors may be returned:

•    455001: The conversation could not be created because the default comment text is blank.
•    455002: The conversation could not be created because there is no source object.
•    455008: The conversation could not be created because there are invalid source objects. A source object must be a WorkspaceObject.
Operation.useCase:
•    A user creates a new public conversation on any Teamcenter object.
Any user can create or update a conversation. Conversations are typically created through Active Workspace on the conversations panel. A conversation must have one or more source objects. A source object can be any Teamcenter WorkspaceObject.

•    A user creates a new private conversation on any Teamcenter object.
Any user can create or update a conversation. Conversations are typically created through Active Workspace on the conversations panel. A conversation must have one or more source objects. A source object can be any Teamcenter WorkspaceObject. Private conversations must contain at least one participant. A participant is a Teamcenter User object.

ParameterInfo.description: The data required to create a new Ac0Conversation object or update an existing Ac0Conversation object.

Operation.description: This operation creates or updates a conversation.
Operation.name: createOrUpdateConversation2
Operation.returnDescription:
The created or updated Ac0Conversation objects. The following partial errors may be returned:

    • 455001: The conversation could not be created because the default comment text is blank.
    • 455002: The conversation could not be created because there is no source object.
    • 455008: The conversation could not be created because there are invalid source objects. A source object must be a WorkspaceObject.
Operation.useCase:
•    A user creates a new public conversation on any Teamcenter object.
Any user can create or update a conversation. Conversations are typically created through Active Workspace on the conversations panel. A public conversation may optionally have participants. A participant is a Teamcenter User object. A conversation must have one or more source objects. A source object can be any Teamcenter WorkspaceObject.

•    A user creates a new private conversation on any Teamcenter object.
Any user can create or update a conversation. Conversations are typically created through Active Workspace on the conversations panel. A conversation must have one or more source objects. A source object can be any Teamcenter WorkspaceObject. Private conversations must contain at least one participant. A participant is a Teamcenter User object.

•    A user creates a new actionable conversation on any Teamcenter object.
Any user can create or update a public or private conversation with a status and priority. Conversations are typically created through Active Workspace on the conversations panel. A conversation must have one or more source objects. A source object can be any Teamcenter WorkspaceObject.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of Ac0Comment object(s) to be deleted.

Operation.description: This operation deletes one or more Ac0Comment object(s).
Operation.name: deleteComment
Operation.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned:
•    455005: The user does not have permission to delete the comment.
•    455007: Object not deleted. The object to delete was not a comment.

ParameterInfo.description: This is a list of Ac0Conversation object(s) to be deleted.

Operation.description: This operation deletes one or more Ac0Conversation object(s).
Operation.name: deleteConversation
Operation.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned:

•    455004: The user does not have permission to delete the conversation.

Operation.description:
This operation returns the information about the objects which may be included in Active Collaboration discussion Ac0Comment objects. Multiple BusinessObject objects can be included in a single Ac0Comment.

The information returned will be the BusinessObject objects included in the comments.
Operation.name: getObjectInfoRelatedToComments
Operation.returnDescription: For each comment object provided, a mapping containing the objects included with the comment and their type is returned.  For example, a comment containing snapshot objects would return “Fnd0Snapshot” for the discussionObjectType and a list of snapshots that were included on the comment.  Null is returned if no objects are included on the comment.
Operation.useCase:
•    Get the snapshot information for a comment object.
When 3D snapshots are shared in comments using the Active Collaboration Discussion feature, the Fnd0Snapshot objects representing the 3D snapshots are included on the corresponding Ac0Comment objects on the discussion. This service operation will get and return the snapshot objects for the given Ac0Comment objects. The returned objects are used by the Active Workspace client to display content or information about the snapshots.

ParameterInfo.description: The list of User objects for which the read privileges of the given objects are desired.
The list of WorkspaceObject objects on which the read privileges for the given users are desired.

Operation.description: Given a list of users and a list of objects, this operation returns the users and objects where the user(s) do not have read access to the object(s).
Operation.name: getReadInfo
Operation.returnDescription:
Two maps with read access information are returned. The userObjectMap contains a user as the key and source objects for which that user does not have read access. The second map, the objectUserMap, contains the object as the key and the users that do not have access to the key object. The following partial errors may be returned:

    • 455009: Read permissions could not be returned because one or more users are required.
    • 455010: Read permissions could not be returned because one or more objects is needed.
    • 455013: Read permissions could not be returned because there are invalid objects. An object must be a WorkspaceObject.
Operation.useCase:
•    A user creating a conversation needs to know which source objects the given participants do not have read access to.

When creating conversations in Active Workspace, a user can select one or more participants for a conversation on one or more source objects. The user creating the conversation needs to know which participants do not have read access to all source objects.

For each participant that does not have read access to one or more source objects, the operation returns a mapping of the participant and the source objects for which that participant does not have read access.    

Using this information, a user creating the conversation can then either know that a participant will not be able to see the message they are writing, or they may do what is needed have the permissions changed for the participant(s) or the source object(s).

•    A user creating a conversation needs to know which participants do not have read access for the source objects on the conversation.

When creating conversations in Active Workspace, a user can select one or more participants for a conversation on one or more source objects. The user creating the conversation needs to know which source objects are not readable by all participants.

For each source object on which any participant does not have read access, the operation returns the source object and the participants that do not have read access to that object.

Using this information, a user creating the conversation can then either know that a participants will not be able to see the message they are writing, or they may do what is needed have the permissions changed for the participant(s) or the source object(s).

ParameterInfo.description: A list of Ac0Conversation objects that the current user will subscribe or unsubscribe to. The objects need to be of Ac0Conversation type.
A list of source objects that the current user will subscribe or unsubscribe to. A sourceObject can be any WorkspaceObject users want to have a conversation about.
If true subscribe to the list of objects. If false unsubscribe to the list of objects.

Operation.description: This operation subscribes or unsubscribes the current user to a list of Ac0Conversation or source objects. The source objects are expected to be WorkspaceObject type. If user subscribe to an Ac0Conversation object, then when new comments are added to the conversation as replies the user will be notified. If user subscribe to a WorkspaceObject, then when new conversations are created for that WorkspaceObject or new comments are added as replies to existing Conversations on that WorkspaceObject, the user will be notified.
Operation.name: manageSubscriptions
Operation.returnDescription:
The operation will return ServiceData object. The following partial errors may be returned:

•    4550011: The subscription or un-subscription could not be processed because there were no conversation or source objects provided.
•    4550012: The subscription or un-subscription could not be processed because there are invalid source objects. A source object must be a WorkspaceObject.
Operation.useCase:
•    Follow or Subscribe to a Conversation
When a user clicks on the “follow” button in an expanded conversation, they will receive notifications when replies are made to the conversation. A conversation is any Ac0Conversation.

•    Unfollow or Unsubscribe to a Conversation
If a user has subscribed to a conversation by clicking on the Follow button on the Conversation, they will now see an “Unfollow” button. Click the Unfollow button to stop receiving notifications when replies are made to the conversation. A conversation is any Ac0Conversation

•    Follow or Subscribe to Conversations for a source object
When a user clicks on the “follow” button in the Conversation panel, they will receive notifications for any replies to existing conversations, as well as for any new conversations created, where the currently selected business object is a source object on the conversation. A source object can be any Teamcenter WorkspaceObject.

•    Unfollow or Unsubscribe to Conversations for a source object
If a user has subscribed to conversations for a source object, they will now see an “Unfollow” button next to the selected source object in the conversation panel. Click the “Unfollow” button to stop receiving notifications for conversation activity related to the selected source object. A source object can be any Teamcenter WorkspaceObject.

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation returns the information about the objects which may be included in Active Collaboration discussion Ac0Comment objects. Multiple BusinessObject objects can be included in a single Ac0Comment.

The information returned will be the BusinessObject objects included in the comments.
OperationTemplate.name: Ac0::Soa::ActiveCollaboration::ActiveCollaboration::getObjectInfoRelatedToComments
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: For each comment object provided, a mapping containing the objects included with the comment and their type is returned.  For example, a comment containing snapshot objects would return “Fnd0Snapshot” for the discussionObjectType and a list of snapshots that were included on the comment.  Null is returned if no objects are included on the comment.

OperationParameter.description: The list of User objects for which the read privileges of the given objects are desired.
OperationParameter.name: users

OperationParameter.description: The list of WorkspaceObject objects on which the read privileges for the given users are desired.
OperationParameter.name: objects

OperationTemplate.description: Given a list of users and a list of objects, this operation returns the users and objects where the user(s) do not have read access to the object(s).
OperationTemplate.name: Ac0::Soa::ActiveCollaboration::ActiveCollaboration::getReadInfo
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Two maps with read access information are returned. The userObjectMap contains a user as the key and source objects for which that user does not have read access. The second map, the objectUserMap, contains the object as the key and the users that do not have access to the key object. The following partial errors may be returned:

    • 455009: Read permissions could not be returned because one or more users are required.
    • 455010: Read permissions could not be returned because one or more objects is needed.
    • 455013: Read permissions could not be returned because there are invalid objects. An object must be a WorkspaceObject.

OperationParameter.name: conversations

OperationParameter.description: A list of source objects that the current user will subscribe or unsubscribe to. A sourceObject can be any WorkspaceObject users want to have a conversation about.
OperationParameter.name: sourceObjects

OperationParameter.description: If true subscribe to the list of objects. If false unsubscribe to the list of objects.
OperationParameter.name: subscriptionFlag

OperationTemplate.description: This operation subscribes or unsubscribes the current user to a list of Ac0Conversation or source objects. The source objects are expected to be WorkspaceObject type. If user subscribe to an Ac0Conversation object, then when new comments are added to the conversation as replies the user will be notified. If user subscribe to a WorkspaceObject, then when new conversations are created for that WorkspaceObject or new comments are added as replies to existing Conversations on that WorkspaceObject, the user will be notified.
OperationTemplate.name: Ac0::Soa::ActiveCollaboration::ActiveCollaboration::manageSubscriptions
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The operation will return ServiceData object. The following partial errors may be returned:

•    4550011: The subscription or un-subscription could not be processed because there were no conversation or source objects provided.
•    4550012: The subscription or un-subscription could not be processed because there are invalid source objects. A source object must be a WorkspaceObject.

ServiceInterface.description: This service contains operations for creating and editing content within Active Collaboration. Operations are provided to manage comments, subscriptions, notification preferences, tags and to control subscriptions.
ServiceInterface.name: ActiveCollaboration

StructElement.description: The original formatted text and content entered by the user using ckeditor.
StructElement.name: richText

StructElement.description: The Ac0Comment root comment object. This will be null if it is the first comment on the conversation.
StructElement.name: rootComment

StructElement.description: The Ac0Comment object to be updated. This is empty if the comment is being created.
StructElement.name: comment

StructElement.description: The Ac0Conversation object this new or updated comment belongs to.
StructElement.name: conversation

Struct.description: The CreateOrUpdateCommentRequest is a data structure that contains the parameters required for the create or update comment request.
Struct.name: CreateOrUpdateCommentRequest

StructElement.description: The original formatted text and content entered by the user.
StructElement.name: richText

StructElement.description: The Ac0Comment root comment object. This is null for the first comment in the conversation.
StructElement.name: rootComment

StructElement.description: The Ac0Comment object to be updated. This is null if the comment is being created.
StructElement.name: comment

StructElement.description: The Ac0Conversation object this new or updated comment belongs to.
StructElement.name: conversation

StructElement.description:
A map (string, string) of key and value pairs used for creating or updating a conversation. This field may be used to associate a related object of a supported type with a comment. This field is optional and should be null when not used. When used, the values must be valid or an error will be thrown. Valid objects that may be associated with an Ac0Comment include:
{“snapshot”, UID of Fnd0Snapshot object}.
StructElement.name: options

Struct.description: The CreateOrUpdateCommentRequest2 is a data structure that contains the parameters required for the create or update comment request.
Struct.name: CreateOrUpdateCommentRequest2

StructElement.description: A list containing BusinessObject objects that are the conversation’s source objects. A sourceObject can be any WorkspaceObject users want to have a conversation about.
StructElement.name: sourceObjects

StructElement.description: A list containing User objects that are the conversation’s participants. This field is null for public conversations. For private conversations this is a mandatory parameter.
StructElement.name: listOfPartipants

StructElement.description: The original formatted text and content entered by the user using ckeditor.   This field contains the text of the initial comment on a conversation.
StructElement.name: defaultCommentText

StructElement.description: The Ac0Conversation object if the conversation is being updated. This parameter is null when the conversation is new.
StructElement.name: conversation

Struct.description: The CreateOrUpdateConversationRequest is a data structure that contains the parameters required for a create or update conversation request.
Struct.name: CreateOrUpdateConversationRequest

StructElement.description: A list containing BusinessObject objects that are the conversation’s source objects. A sourceObject can be any WorkspaceObject users want to have a conversation about.
StructElement.name: sourceObjects

StructElement.description: A list containing User objects that are the conversation’s participants. This field is null for public conversations. For private conversations this is a mandatory parameter.
StructElement.name: listOfParticipants

StructElement.description: The original formatted text and content. This field contains the text of the initial comment on a conversation.
StructElement.name: defaultCommentText

StructElement.description: The priority of the conversation. The possible value for priority are “High”, “Medium” and “Low”.  An empty value means there is no priority set for the conversation.
StructElement.name: priority

StructElement.description: The status of the conversation. The possible value for status are “Open”, “In Progress” and “Closed”.  An empty value means there is no status set for the conversation.
StructElement.name: status

StructElement.description: If true, the conversation is private; otherwise, the conversation is public.
StructElement.name: isPrivate

StructElement.description: A map of key and value pairs  (string, string) used for creating or updating a conversation. This is a future placeholder for name value pairs to hold metadata about a conversation. Currently its value will be empty.
StructElement.name: options

StructElement.description: The Ac0Conversation object if the conversation is being updated. This parameter is null when the conversation is new.
StructElement.name: conversation

Struct.description: The CreateOrUpdateConversationRequest2 is a data structure that contains the parameters required for a create or update conversation request.
Struct.name: CreateOrUpdateConversationRequest2

StructElement.description: A map (Ac0Comment, TypeObjectInfo) of comment objects and the lists of BusinessObject objects included on the comment. For a given comment, the caller can get the list of related BusinessObject objects for each type in the TypeObjectInfo.
StructElement.name: output

StructElement.description: The service data that will contains the partial errors if any.
StructElement.name: serviceData

Struct.description: The GetRelatedObjectInfoToCommentsResp contains a map that associates comment objects to a list of included objects and the ServiceData.
Struct.name: GetRelatedObjectInfoToCommentsResp

StructElement.description: The map (User, list of BusinessObject) of User entries that correspond to a list of WorkspaceObject objects for which the User does not have read permissions.  The map will be empty if all provided users have read access to all provided objects.
StructElement.name: userObjectMap

StructElement.description: The map (BusinessObject, list of User) of WorkspaceObject entries that correspond to a list of User objects that do not have read permission for the given WorkspaceObject.
StructElement.name: objectUserMap

StructElement.description: The Service Data.
StructElement.name: serviceData

Struct.description: The ReadResponse is a data structure that holds maps containing the requested users and objects where read privileges have not been granted.
Struct.name: ReadResponse

StructElement.description: The type of BusinessObject included in an Active Collaboration Discussion Ac0Comment. Supported values are: “Fnd0Snapshot” and others in the future. The value will be “Fnd0Snapshot” when a snapshot is being shared in a comment.
StructElement.name: discussionObjectType

StructElement.description: A list of BusinessObject objects that are included on an Active Collaboration Discussion Ac0Comment object. The list will contain Fnd0Snapshot objects when the discussionObjectType is “Fnd0Snapshot”. Other object types will be supported in the future.
StructElement.name: relatedObjList

Struct.description:
The TypeObjectInfo is a data structure that contains the BusinessObject objects included in the comment.

For example, if a snapshot is being shared in a comment, then the TypeObjectInfo will have a discussionObjectType value of “Fnd0Snapshot” and the relatedObjList will contain a list of snapshot objects.
Struct.name: TypeObjectInfo

Typedef.description: The OptionValues map is used for options for create/update conversation. The key and value are case sensitive.
Typedef.name: KeyValues

Typedef.description: The ObjectRelatedCommentMap is a used to map the comment object to a list of the related objects associated with the comment object. The key is the comment object, and the value is a list of related objects associated with the comment object.
Typedef.name: ObjectRelatedCommentMap

Typedef.description: The objectUserMap contains objects and a corresponding list of users that do not have read access to the given object.
Typedef.name: ObjectUserMap

Typedef.description: The userObjectMap contains user objects and a corresponding list of business objects that the given user does not have read access to.
Typedef.name: UserObjectMap
